newsitem.title: USA: Calif. state Assembly Democrats tap next Speaker.
newsitem.headline: Calif. state Assembly Democrats tap next Speaker.

text.p: California state Assembly Democrats on Thursday tapped Cruz M. Bustamante as the next Speaker of the Assembly.

Bustamante, a 43-year-old from Fresno, Calif., generally described as a moderate Democrat, will replace Republican Speaker Curt Pringle. Bustamante also succeeds Assemblyman Richard Katz as leader of Assembly Democrats.
Katz made the announcement after a three-hour closed meeting with fellow Democrats in Sacramento.
The formal speakership vote on Bustamante will not take place until December 2, when state Assembly members will be sworn in for the new legislative session.
In Tuesday's election, Democrats regained control of the 80-member Assembly. They now hold a clear majority. Democrats also strengthened their hold on the state Senate.
